title: of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Recognition of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Recognition of 

Professional Qualifications) (Amendment) Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (recognition professional qualifications) (amendment) regulation 2025

title: of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the European Union
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the European Union 
(Recognition of Professional Qualifications) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 8 of 
2017).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean european union (recognition professional qualifications) regulation 2017 (s.i no 8 2017)

title: of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 3. Regulation 3(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended, in the definition
text_raw:
3. Regulation 3(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended, in the definition 
of “Directive”, by the substitution of “, Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 
2016/790 of 13 January 20163, Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 
2017/2113 of 11 September 20174, Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 
2019/608 of 16 January 20195, Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 2020/548 
of 23 January 20206, Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 2021/2183 of 25 
August 20217, Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 2023/2383 of 23 May 
20238 and Directive (EU) 2024/505 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 7 February 20249” for “and Commission Delegated Decision (EU) 
2016/790 of 13 January 201610”.

title: of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 4. Regulation 38 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
4. Regulation 38 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of the following paragraphs for paragraph (3): 

“(3) In the case of an applicant who trained as a nurse responsible for 
general care in Romania and whose training does not satisfy the minimum 
training requirements laid down in Article 31 of the Directive, the 

1 OJ No. L. 255, 30.9.2005, p. 22. 
2 OJ L, 2024/505, 12.2.2024. 
3 OJ No. L. 134, 24.5.2016, p. 135. 
4 OJ No. L. 317, 1.12.2017, p. 119. 
5 OJ No. L. 104, 15.4.2019, p. 1. 
6 OJ No. L. 131, 24.4.2020, p. 1. 
7 OJ No. L. 444, 10.12.2021, p. 16. 
8 OJ L, 2023/2383, 9.10.2023, p. 1. 
9 OJ L, 2025/505, 12.2.2024. 
10 OJ No. L. 134, 24.5.2016, p. 135. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 13th May, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [178] 3 

competent authority in the State for general nurses shall recognise as 
sufficient proof: 

(a) 

any of the following evidence of formal qualification as a nurse 
responsible for general care, provided that such evidence is 
accompanied by a certificate stating that the applicant has 
effectively and lawfully been engaged in the activities of a nurse 
responsible for general care in Romania, including taking full 
responsibility for the planning, organisation and carrying out of 
the nursing care of patients, for a period of at least three 
consecutive years during the five years prior to the date of issue 
of the certificate: 

(i) Certificat de competențe profesionale de asistent medical 
generalist with post-secondary education obtained from a 
școală postliceală, attesting to training started before 1 
January 2007; 

(ii) Diplomă de absolvire de asistent medical generalist with 
short-time higher education studies, attesting to training 
started before 1 October 2003; or 

(iii) Diplomă de licență de asistent medical generalist with 
long-time higher education studies, attesting to training 
started before 1 October 2003; 

(b) 

any of the evidence of formal qualification listed in clauses (ii) 
and (iii) of subparagraph (a), provided that such evidence is 
accompanied by the following evidence of formal qualification 
obtained on the basis of a special upgrading programme: 

Diplomă de licenţă referred to in Article 3(2) of Joint Order 
of the Minister of National Education and of the Minister of 
Health No 4317/943/2014 of 11 August 2014 on the 
approval of the special upgrading programme for the initial 
training of nurse responsible for general care acquired prior 
to 1 January 2007 for graduates of post-secondary 
education and higher education (Official Journal of 
Romania No 624 of 26 August 2014), accompanied by a 
Diploma Supplement stating that the student has completed 
the special upgrading programme; or 

(c) 

any of the evidence of formal qualifications of post-secondary 
level listed under Article 4 of Order of the Minister of National 
Education No 5114/2014 on the approval of the methodology for 
organising, conducting and completing the special upgrading 
programme for the initial training of nurse responsible for general 
care acquired prior to 1 January 2007 for graduates of postsecondary education (Official Journal of Romania No 5 of 6 
January 2015), provided that such evidence is accompanied by 
the following evidence of formal qualification obtained on the 
basis of a special upgrading programme: 

Certificat de revalorizare a competenţelor profesionale 
referred to in Article 3(1) and in Annex 3 to Joint Order 

 
 
 4 [178] 

of the Minister of National Education and of the Minister 
of Health No 4317/943/2014 and in Article 16 of Order 
of the Minister of National Education No 5114/2014. 

(4) The competent authority in the State for general nurses shall recognise 
the Romanian qualification as a nurse responsible for general care pursuant 
to Articles 10 to 14 of the Directive where such qualification was granted 
before 3 March 2024 in the case of nationals of Member States who were 
trained as a nurse responsible for general care in Romania and did not meet 
the requirements of - 

(a) Article 33a of the Directive in the version in force on 1 January 

2007, or 

(b) Article 33a of 

the Directive, as amended by Directive 
2013/55/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council11.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

29 April, 2025. 

JAMES LAWLESS, 

Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science. 

11 OJ No. L. 354, 28.12.2013, p. 132. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [178] 5
